alert.note: Alert for Cass; Fulton; Huntington; Pulaski; Wabash (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 07 at 7:19PM EDT until May 08 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern Indiana, including the following counties, Cass IN, Fulton IN, Huntington, Miami, Pulaski and Wabash. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 719 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Huntington, Wabash, Rochester, Winamac, Andrews, Francesville, Medaryville, Mexico, Pulaski, Warren, Lancaster, Ripley, Kewanna, Erie, Denver, Roann, Lagro, Fulton, Macy and Mount Etna. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
